New Records: Chris Jordan became the first England player to take a men's T20I hat-trick
Adil Rashid equaled Stuart Broad's tally of 30 dismissals in T20 World Cups
Key Match Events: England won by 10 wickets (with 62 balls remaining)
USA collapsed from 115 for 5 to 115 all out
Jos Buttler raced to 44 from 26 deliveries at the end of the powerplay
Buttler struck five sixes in an over
Post-Match Reflections: England have booked their place in the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup 2024
Such a dominant win was set-up by Chris Jordan's hat-trick and overall figures of 4 for 10
Jordan's place in history has been secured
Miscellaneous Highlights: England will finish top of the group if West Indies beat South Africa in Group 2's final fixture by a margin fewer than 52 runs
A South Africa win, taking them to six points, will see England finish second
Others: Chris Jordan did not expect to be at this World Cup
Jordan was actually at home in Barbados when he heard of his call-up to the provisional squad at the end of April
Jordan was brought back into the XI for Mark Wood
Adil Rashid continued a stellar campaign with a miserly 2 for 13 from his four overs
Aaron Jones, one of the USA's stronger players of spin, and top-scorer Nitish Kumar were bowled by Rashid
